Solaris 9 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101933 criteria.

metadata.title: OpenSSL Integer Overflow Vulnerability
metadata.description: Integer overflow in OpenSSL 0.9.6 and 0.9.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via an SSL client certificate with certain ASN.1 tag values.

criterion.comment: Apache running with SunPlex Manager config

metadata.title: Security Vulnerability in the kcms_calibrate(1) Command
metadata.description: Unspecified vulnerability in kcms_calibrate in Sun Solaris 8 and 9 before 20071122 allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via unknown vectors.

metadata.title: Solaris 9 CDE ToolTalk Database Null Write Vulnerability
metadata.description: CDE ToolTalk database server (ttdbserver) allows remote attackers to overwrite arbitrary memory locations with a zero, and possibly gain privileges, via a file descriptor argument in an AUTH_UNIX procedure call, which is used as a table index by the _TT_ISCLOSE procedure.

reference.ref_id: 20020710 [CORE-20020528] Multiple vulnerabilities in ToolTalk Database server

metadata.title: Solaris 9 Systems With Solaris Auditing (BSM) Enabled may Panic if Certain Audit Classes are Being Audited
metadata.description: Unspecified vulnerability in Sun Solaris 9, when Solaris Auditing (BSM) is enabled for file read, write, attribute modify, create, or delete audit classes, allows local users to cause a denial of service (panic) via unknown vectors, possibly related to the audit_savepath function.

criteria.comment: Solaris 9 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 102900 criteria.
Solaris 9 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 102900 criteria.

metadata.title: Security Vulnerability in GNU tar May Lead to Arbitrary Code Execution or Denial of Service (DoS)
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in tar 1.14 through 1.15.90 allows user-assisted attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute code via unspecified vectors involving PAX extended headers.

metadata.title: Patches Disable Basic Security Module Auditing Functionality
metadata.description: The patches (1) 114332-08 and (2) 114929-06 for Sun Solaris 9 disable the auditing functionality of the Basic Security Module (BSM), which allows attackers to avoid having their activity logged.

metadata.title: Kerberos 5 ASN.1 Library DoS
metadata.description: The asn1buf_skiptail function in the ASN.1 decoder library for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.2.2 through 1.3.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a certain BER encoding.

criterion.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

metadata.title: Samba Encrypted Password DoS
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in samba 2.2.2 through 2.2.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via an encrypted password that causes the overflow during decryption in which a DOS codepage string is converted to a little-endian UCS2 unicode string.

reference.ref_id: 20021129 [OpenPKG-SA-2002.012] OpenPKG Security Advisory (samba)
20021121 GLSA: samba

metadata.title: Buffer Management Error in OpenSSH
metadata.description: A "buffer management error" in buffer_append_space of buffer.c for OpenSSH before 3.7 may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by causing an incorrect amount of memory to be freed and corrupting the heap, a different vulnerability than CVE-2003-0695.

metadata.title: Security Vulnerability in GNU tar May Lead to Arbitrary Code Execution or Denial of Service (DoS)
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in tar 1.14 through 1.15.90 allows user-assisted attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute code via unspecified vectors involving PAX extended headers.

metadata.title: Security Vulnerability in Solaris 9 fstat(2) System Call May Lead to a System Panic, Resulting in a Denial of Service (DoS)
metadata.description: The kernel in Sun Solaris 9 allows local users to cause a denial of service (panic) by calling fstat with a first argument of AT_FDCWD.

metadata.title: Kerberos Client Plaintext Password Vulnerability
metadata.description: Solaris 9, when configured as a Kerberos client with patch 112908-12 or 115168-03 and using pam_krb5 as an "auth" module with the debug feature enabled, records passwords in plaintext, which could allow local users to gain other user's passwords by reading log files.

criterion.comment: /etc/pam.conf is configured to use pam_krb5 as an 'auth' module and the debug feature of pam_krb5 is enabled
/etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain
/etc/syslog.conf is configured to log "debug" level messages for at least daemon

metadata.title: Kerberos 5 Double-free Vulnerability in krb5_rd_cred Function
metadata.description: Double free vulnerability in the krb5_rd_cred function for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.3.1 and earlier may allow local users to execute arbitrary code.

criterion.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

metadata.title: Kerberos 5 KDC ASN.1 Error Handling Double-free Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Double free vulnerabilities in the error handling code for ASN.1 decoders in the (1) Key Distribution Center (KDC) library and (2) client library for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.3.4 and earlier may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

criterion.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

metadata.title: Off-by-one Error in fb_realpath()
metadata.description: Off-by-one error in the fb_realpath() function, as derived from the realpath function in BSD, may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code, as demonstrated in wu-ftpd 2.5.0 through 2.6.2 via commands that cause pathnames of length MAXPATHLEN+1 to trigger a buffer overflow, including (1) STOR, (2) RETR, (3) APPE, (4) DELE, (5) MKD, (6) RMD, (7) STOU, or (8) RNTO.

metadata.title: sshd Log Bypass Vulnerability
metadata.description: The Secure Shell (SSH) Daemon (SSHD) in Sun Solaris 9 does not properly log IP addresses when SSHD is configured with the ListenAddress as 0.0.0.0, which makes it easier for remote attackers to hide the source of their activities.

metadata.title: SunOS 5.9: ufs and fsck patch
metadata.description: The Sun Solaris Volume Manager (SVM) on Solaris 9 allows local users to cause a denial of service (kernel panic) via a malformed probe request to the SVM.

metadata.title: A Security Vulnerability in the in.iked(1M) Service May Lead To a Denial of Service (DoS)
metadata.description: The libike library in Sun Solaris 9 before 20070529 contains a logic error related to a certain pointer, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (in.iked daemon crash) by sending certain UDP packets with a source port different from 500. NOTE: this issue might overlap CVE-2006-2298.

metadata.title: XFS Dispatch() Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Dispatch() routine for XFS font server (fs.auto) on Solaris 2.5.1 through 9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a certain XFS query.

reference.ref_id: 20021125 ISS Security Brief: Solaris fs.auto Remote Compromise Vulnerability

criterion.comment: X Window System Font Server (SUNWxwfs) installed

metadata.title: Clear Text Password Logging Vulnerability
metadata.description: Solaris 9, when configured as a Kerberos client with patch 112908-12 or 115168-03 and using pam_krb5 as an "auth" module with the debug feature enabled, records passwords in plaintext, which could allow local users to gain other user's passwords by reading log files.

Solaris 9 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101519 criteria.

metadata.title: Sendmail Custom DNS Map Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Sendmail before 8.12.5, when configured to use a custom DNS map to query TXT records, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a malicious DNS server.

metadata.title: Solaris 9 CDE ToolTalk Database Server Symbolic Link Vulnerability
metadata.description: CDE ToolTalk database server (ttdbserver) allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the transaction log file used by the _TT_TRANSACTION RPC procedure.

reference.ref_id: 20020710 [CORE-20020528] Multiple vulnerabilities in ToolTalk Database server

metadata.title: Bind OPT Resource Record DoS Vulnerability
metadata.description: BIND 8.3.x through 8.3.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (termination due to assertion failure) via a request for a subdomain that does not exist, with an OPT resource record with a large UDP payload size.

reference.ref_id: 20021112 [Fwd: Notice of serious vulnerabilities in ISC BIND 4 & 8]
20021115 [OpenPKG-SA-2002.011] OpenPKG Security Advisory (bind, bind8)

metadata.title: MIT Kerberos 5 Multiple Double-Free Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Double free vulnerabilities in error handling code in krb524d for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.2.8 and earlier may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: Solaris 9 sshd(1M) Patches May Cause Incorrect Audit Data to be Logged
metadata.description: Solaris 9, with Solaris Auditing enabled and certain patches for sshd installed, can generate audit records with an audit-ID of 0 even when the user logging into ssh is not root, which makes it easier for attackers to avoid detection and can make it more difficult to conduct forensics activities.

metadata.title: Samba call_trans2open() Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the call_trans2open function in trans2.c for Samba 2.2.x before 2.2.8a, 2.0.10 and earlier 2.0.x versions, and Samba-TNG before 0.3.2, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
